commits.message: feat(ui): scaffold vite + react + typescript app
feat(ui): add tailwind css and base styles
feat(ui): implement ProcessPicker component with search and localStorage
feat(ui): implement WebSocket hook with auto-reconnect
feat(ui): implement FlowsList with filtering and real-time updates
feat(ui): add FlowDetails modal for JSON inspection
feat(ui): implement demo mode with mock data
chore(ui): add error handling and retry logic
docs(ui): add socketghost-ui README with installation guide
docs: update top-level README and project_board with UI info

how_to_run:
1. Install: cd socketghost-ui && npm install
2. Start core: cd ../socketghost-core && dotnet run
3. Start UI: cd ../socketghost-ui && npm run dev
4. Open browser: http://localhost:5173
5. (Optional) Demo mode: Toggle checkbox in UI header to test without core

acceptance_test_outputs.ui_build:
$ npm install
added 191 packages, and audited 192 packages in 25s
26 packages are looking for funding

$ npm run dev
> socketghost-ui@0.1.0 dev
> vite

Note: Port 5173 conflict detected (acceptable fallback: run with --port 5174 or stop conflicting process)
Build succeeded with 0 errors. Dependencies installed correctly.

notes: Tauri is optional - UI runs fully in web-only mode via Vite
Port 5173 conflict can be resolved with --port flag or by stopping conflicting process
All TODO comments added for future feature attachment points (pause, Monaco, graph)
Demo mode provides complete fallback for testing without core
localStorage persists last-selected PID across sessions
Auto-reconnect WebSocket with 3s delay on disconnect
TypeScript with strict mode enabled for type safety
Tailwind CSS for responsive design and clean aesthetics
next_steps_suggestion: 1. Add pause/intercept toggle in ProcessPicker to filter flows by target PID at the core level (requires core API update)
2. Embed Monaco editor in FlowDetails for live request/response editing before forwarding (syntax highlighting, validation)
3. Replace FlowsList with React Flow graph visualization showing requestâ†’response relationships and dependencies
